Siam @ Siam Design Hotel Pattaya
8.6 Excellent
Based on 5859 reviews

The room is quite small, not much of a view of the ocean. Stayed for 2 nights. Expensive drinks and food.

Nice infinity pool at the top floor. Housekeeping could have done a better job of cleanliness. The bed is too soft for my liking. Modern facilities and design however many of the furnitures and furnishing are getting a bit used. Even the sofa and bed sheets have visable stain on them. Friendly and passionate staff. Value for your money but I might consider other newer hotels in my future visits. Overall: a decent stay.

Show more
Alan , Canada
Le Bali Resort & Spa
6.6 Good
Based on 6 reviews

Cape Dara Resort
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5931 reviews

Arrived at the hotel a bit early at 12.00 pm....and was promptly informed that I could not check in until 2.

00 pm. I asked if a room could be allocated and a priority clean, and to call me when the room was ready. No call and the room was not available until 3.10 pm and only after a complaint to the manager. Had lunch while waiting, the food ordered has clearly been pre-cooked and heated up, dry and unpleasant....expected better from this hotel, I did complain and was not charged for it in the end. Breakfast was very busy, the hotel was fully booked so it was a bit manic at breakfast. The buffet food was okay, it was the typical breakfast that most hotels and resorts put on in Thailand. The hotel building is very nice, the room was reasonable with a great view of the sea and beach, the bathroom was big and clean. The pool area was very busy, lots of Chinese tourists with kids. The car park was good as it was under cover. Overall would consider this hotel again.

Show more
Peter , Australia
Hilton Pattaya
8.9 Excellent
Based on 3383 reviews

Indeed the best service provided by the hotel, I was staying with my 2 months old girl, unfortunately the day we were staying were also Songkran celebrate, so the voice is extremely loud, eventually I decided to check out and loss my rest of nights stay due to non-refundable policy,I didn't even wish to complaint as it is beyong hotel's contorl as well, however hotel did everything that they can induced a free upgrade to a better quite room for me.

Surely true 5 stars standard services.

Show more
Yi , China
LK The Empress
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4172 reviews

This is my second time staying at an LK hotel. My first experience was at the LK Metro and it was an amazing time and i had absolutely no issues.

It felt like a home more than a hotel. I was unable to secure rooms at the LK Metro for my last trip i took these past two weeks so sticking with what i knew i booked my stay at the LK Empress. I couldnt have made a better decision. I showed up a day early due to a miscalculation on my part so i had to stay at the pattaya center hotel and i was assailed by giant cockroaches in the elevator. The next day i finally got my room and it was like night and day compared to my previous nights accommodations. This place is CLEAN folks, down to the corners was clean. The employees are extremely courteous and helpful and always professional. The room was impeccable. Bathroom was spotless and had a pleasant smell and didnt reek of cleaning supplies. The bed was made quite sharply. Would have passed my inspection when i was in the military, tucked corners, etc. The breakfast is good, the dining room is beautiful, i felt like royalty, maybe because im peasant but it is very luxurious in my opinion. Its location on beach road is right in the middle of the best shopping and nightlife pattaya has to offer. It is also vistor friendly to those that make a lot of new friends while youre on vacation. I know i always leave thailand with at least one new friend made. The thai people are just good all around if youre good to them. All in all you cant go wrong staying at an LK hotel in my experience.

Show more
richard , United States
Movenpick Siam Hotel Na Jomtien Pattaya
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1363 reviews

We visited while the grounds were finished (from the front, it was unclear if it was in use at all), but the furnishings inside, including the lavish buffet so well-reviewed in other traveler's comments, were in prime condition.

It is a bit of a way from the beach, but with my needs as a family traveler, the pool and beach did fairly well, and the welcoming snacks did a number as well. I will definitely consider the Movenpick as a traveler with some experience, but for those unsure of how to get a taxi (or motorbike) where they want to go if their cell battery runs out, you might have some difficulty handling this on the fly. In other words, plan ahead, and you'll be fine.

Show more
Matthew , United States
A-One The Royal Cruise Hotel Pattaya
8.1 Excellent
Based on 240 reviews

This Hotel is awesome. Rooms are very comfortable and we had a Partial View of the beach. Everything in this hotel was great.

But we didn't eat at the Hotel so I can not tell you of the restaurant. The only problem I see is the Staff. They walk by you like you don't exist. They will answer your questions when asked but never even look at you when approaching them. I stayed here 4th of march and the desk personnel were very professional but still could not force a smile. I came back her on the 7th through the 9th of March and the desk receptionist asked for a charge card. When I asked why I need to give her my charge card number she got rude with me and felt she didn't need to explain. she tripped over her poor english and then gave me to another woman standing next to her and walked away but in hearing distance. The woman then explained that I didn't need to give my card the first time(4th of march) because I only stayed one day. While she is explaining this the other woman is slamming phones down and made several comments in Thai. All i was trying to get is a clarification as to why they needed my card in which this woman explained and I excepted. This woman still was being very angry in her movements. when we walked away from the desk the nice girl came over and apologized and wished us a nice stay. I wrote this because A-One Cruise Hotel is awesome and a person behind the desk with such an attitude ruins a small part of your time your trying to enjoy. I'm sure she was just having a bad day but could find other ways to clean her brain out instead of a hotel Guest. I do highly recommend this hotel. Just stay away from the desk hahaha. good times ALL!!! But I found in all of my time in Pattaya smiling and giving a daily greeting does not get a response.

Show more
george , United States
March Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1237 reviews

If you want to have easy access to North Pattaya but still be close to Central and all points south, the March Hotel is imo an excellent choice.

The reception staff are pleasant (if not sometimes overly friendly) but the other employees, the door attendants, the maids, the service people are super nice and helpful. I arrived a couple of hours early from another local hotel just expecting to kill some time before check-in. But as soon as they saw me walking up, the attendants rushed out to help me with my luggage, escorted me to reception (where I was checked in early) and then took my bags to my room. And almost everytime I leave or return to the hotel, the guys are there to open the door for me. My room was very modern with wifi and usb panels, a separate shower and tub, and a larger than average flat screen tv. As other reviewers have noted the only downside for some is that the hotel is a bit of a walk from the main roads (Central and 2nd). That is true. Not a problem for me but it might be for some. The plus side to that however is the hotel is very quiet at night. With that said, I'd definitely recommend you take a look at the March if you want to be in the general area.

Show more
Don , United States
D Varee Jomtien Beach Pattaya Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 8628 reviews

The breakfast buffet was delicious, the chilled spaghetti with the white mystery sauce was our favorite, it was so popular we had to contend with the other guests heaping mountains of it onto their plates! Even though breakfast ended [abruptly] earlier than other hotels (10:00 AM), the upside was that we were forced to get up earlier and seize the day! We enjoyed the beautiful view from our balcony; the lack of chairs on the balcony only helped to firm up our leg muscles.

The waitstaff was courteous and very knowledgeable. Although our friendly waiter initially told us that the restaurant didn't serve the Belgian beer that was prominently advertised by the restaurant entrance (oopsies!), it was a pleasure chatting and educating him about our passion (at least the parts he heard over the deafening band). We made many friends during the endless waits for the elevators, what gregarious fellow travelers! Would recommend to any hordes of giant tour groups hailing from the north!

Show more
Matthew , United States
Pattaya Blue Sky
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2039 reviews

The pattaya blue sky hotel is a great choice and is situated towards the northern end of pattaya, situated on soi 5 close enough for the nightlife (and daytime) activities of the nearby soi 6.

There are a couple of soapy massage places also nearby and the drinking street complex. The hotel is relitively new and modern, checking process was painless and took minutes, there is 1x lift in the lobby area, The rooms have the traditional key lock on doors and for power in the rooms as opposed to the key card type commonly used in other hotels. View from my room (503) was not up to much, but i am not in Pattaya to sit on a balcony so this was not an issue. Staff were excellent especially the cleaners who were always talkative, happy and joking as well as doing a great job. The hotel is also completely joiner friendly for those taking a guest back to the hotel. Rooftop pool area was very nice and quiet when i was there last week. I did not sample the food as i ate outside every time, so no comment on that. Overall a very good stay there, i have moved further down to another hotel on soi 10 but was regretting not just spending my entire stash here, but hey ho, it is what it is. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Pattaya. Enjoy...........

Show more
Arthur , United Kingdom
Baywalk Residence
7.6 Very good
Based on 6440 reviews

When we reached hotel, is already 8pm..we yet have our dinner and freaking tired after whole day flight plus waiting taxi at airport! However, the hotel not allow us check in due to some mistake when we book via agoda! We choose 4 pax in a room and added bed, however, when booking voucher print out it show 3 pax with 3 breakfast.

We told hotel we don't mind to add one more room but please deduct out the payment for adding bed early. Too bad was the hotel ask me call agoda to settle! After contact agoda, agoda told us contact them after one hour. So v decide put our luggage and went for dinner! After one hour, agoda told us can check in now! Too bad was, the reception stil not allow us chevk in said didn't received confirmation from agoda(I already pass the call to them which calling from agoda) and ask me check in tmr cause now agoda counter already closed! I and mad and request see their manager, and lucky the manager very helpful and manage to settle the problem within a minute! Therefore, I definitely won't come back to this unfriendly hotel again!

Show more
Thong , Malaysia
Imperial Pattaya Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 1149 reviews

Stayed there at the end of September. The positives was that it wasn't really busy which meant you had the pool area more or less to yourself.

The pool by the way is one of the biggest I have seen in Asia. The location is great, and it's true that each room has a balcony with a sea view. The staff are very helpful and the Lobby area is spotless clean as well as the toilets. The negatives are, the bathroom and rooms are looking a bit tired. Big stains on the carpet and our bathtub drain was constantly blocked, despite having maintenance visit us. Breakfast was ok, but don't ask for poached eggs. It caused a bit of a debate and finally I was told it would take 30 minutes. Finally, I ordered ice one night and was told no problem. When the small bucket arrived I was asked to sign for it. Turns out I had to pay the equivalent of £1 for it. I have travelled all over the world and never been asked to pay for ice. I should have been informed upfront on the phone, not when it was delivered. Overall for the money it was good. Would I go back? Maybe if they tidied up the rooms I would.

Show more
Alan , United Kingdom
Areca Lodge Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 4918 reviews

So here's my story... I call at 11:25 to ask if check-out is at 12:00 and the receptionist confirms. But: At 11:57 I get a call from reception of the Evergreen lobby telling me I have to check out before 12:00.

Well, I already knew that since I called to ask just before. I find it very impolite to call a guest to say you have to be gone before 12:00. Especially, since someone could not be feeling well, for instance, or have another valid reason why it might take a few minutes extra. It was my 4th or 5th time at Areca Lodge, but also my last. I travel all over the world and this has never happened to me. Maybe the receptionists are trained to do this, but that is not my problem. I find it highly inappropriate. The receptionists apologized to me when I checked out, but that's easy to do... after the fact. Also: breakfast is not very good. Every day the same and not always everything heated properly. Some things might be laying there too long. Next time, I will book another hotel in Pattaya.

Show more
Ronald , Netherlands
Adelphi Pattaya Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 655 reviews

1st I would like to say that all of the staff that i came into contact with were exceptional. their SOS (AKA Spirit Of Service) is 5 stars.

the front office staff, upon my arrival, had me processed & in my room within a matter of a few minutes & throughout my 10 days stay they were always helpful, informative & polite. their fantastic ability to communicate in English had a lot to do with my stay being a flawless one. the housekeeping staff were also fantastic & they keep the entire hotel in immaculate condition. both the public areas and the guest rooms. they are never intrusive, fast & efficient & always polite. upon arrival the settings in my laptop were not allowing me to connect to the WiFi and the IT staff who came to help arrived quickly, and he was excellent. he had me online in minutes, and i never had another problem. i always rent a motorcycle when in Pattaya so it was good to know that the hotel has great security in the basement garage & also elsewhere. these staff were always polite & never made me or my guests feel uncomfortable. having had a motorbike stolen a few years ago from another property where i was staying it really was a comfort to know that my bike was secure at Adelphi. the key card access for the elevator & rooms is state of the art. once while leaving my room i had accidentally left my room door ajar & the door lock signaled to me that i had not closed the door 100%. I think this is a great security feature. my biggest complaint about this property is that my room rate included breakfast & i must say that this was way below par. i found the European foods available to be poorly prepared, poorly presented & not worth the extra charges. i ate breakfast outside the hotel on all of my remaining days. having worked in & managed hotel F & B facilities in TH since 1992 i think i am qualified to say that there is no excuse for this. good products are available & well trained staff are as well. however, the Thai food i ordered from Room

Show more
David , United States
At Mind Serviced Residence
8 Very good
Based on 4768 reviews

In previous reviews I have complained about the long walk into the back building late at night. So as to ensure this didn't occur again I specifically booked a front building room.

Upon arriving late at night however room was not available. For reasons they couldn't explain had been given to someone else. Apology the next day and transfer to correct room followed.... Unfortunately things got worse. One week after checking in my Thai wife and I attended a function with family and friends to celebrate our wedding. A second function for those not able to attend in Australia 10 days prior. Upon arriving back to the hotel my wife (dressed in wedding dress) was refused entry by security and reception. ID card / passport was in room safe. Huge blowup followed. Asked to speak to manager .... not on site. No manager either upon checkout the following day. In short I will avoid this place from now on. They bend over backwards to keep Chinese tour groups happy but couldn't care less about western or Thai nationals. Shame shame @Mind

Show more
Doug , Australia
Hotel Vista
7.9 Very good
Based on 3167 reviews

The hotel is along Soi 4 so finding it is not difficult, both Tiffany and Alcazar is within walking distance.

Checking in was easy although not fast considering the entire stay is prepaid. The hotel requires 1,000 baht as security deposit. Was upgraded to a room facing the pool. I've booked a double bed room but was given a twin bed joined together, the room is clean, had a balcony with bench by the wall. The cloth hanger is not removable and therefore prefer a cloth line at the balcony for hanging laundry to dry. The toilet comes with full amenities although a single set of bath solution and shampoo may not be enough especially if the day activities involve the beach. The gym is small but fully equipped, didn't tried the steamroom because it looks small. The breakfast is good, menu changes everyday. Checking out is easy although you have to find your own transport to the bus terminal back to Bangkok.

Show more
Keng , Singapore
Holiday Inn Pattaya
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2876 reviews

A great stay in the Executive Tower with a Pool/Pattaya beach facing room on the twelfth floor. Went as a couple, excellent and clean infinity pool, some great staff, excellent service and super amazing hotel which was not so full in the quiet Executive Tower with new rooms with the perfect location right next to Pattaya beach and other attractions.

The Tea Tree Spa can be a little better compared to other Holiday Inn Spas in terms of service and quality of relaxation. Very close to Pattaya shopping, restaurants, tourist attractions and transportation right on Beach road.

Show more
KARL , India
Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4891 reviews

My main reason for this time stay was to find out how comfortable this hotel is, coz I have a plan to visit pattaya during July with a family group of 9 people so far and number may increase to 14 therefore need to take minimum 4 rooms and can increase to 6 rooms.

I found that thus hotel was comfortable, staff were very friendly and available whenever needed in addition the pool was Amazing I really liked this hotel from all aspects

Show more
Nabeel , Bahrain
A-One Star Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 2704 reviews

My fault for arriving 1 day early. But then to charge me the price of 3200TB? Ok as stated my fault for arriving a day early so I paid as I did not want to take a walk to try and find another room for one night.

Asked if we were going to change rooms the next night (no need to unpack if we were going to). Told NO stay in room. Asked about breakfast for our 5 day stay. No breakfast! But I did order double bed with breakfast. "No order single room!" Not one to argue especially with lady friend took key card and went up to room 5454 (on 4th floor). Surprise, surprise, 2 single beds, toilet with knees almost hitting wall (yeah I am tall) and a shower in a closet. Only way to describe it. Like to shower together and in order for both of us to get in one had to scoot into a corner. Rain head shower almost hitting me in the head. Had a balcony with no furniture, not even a chair in the room. Not a chair or table in sight. Made it thru the night and made arrangements for a different hotel for the rest of stay. Next day get a phone call to vacate room. check out time early and check in time at new hotel late. Thought we were staying in same room. Go down and talk with supervisor. Change room and you get breakfast! YOU told me no breakfast! 10 minutes later up in new superior room. SAME as old room, but 6554 just different on 5th floor. Didn't even unpack just took bags down to desk and told them we are leaving. Oh wait we upgrade you! No thanks. Non refundable! Keep as it as price for a new and different experience. The review will be worth it. All that being said I would recommend this hotel for backpackers, small, short people, and people that do not want to be in bed with their partners. Bring your own chair if you want to enjoy the Large balcony. (which is as big as the room) LOL

Show more
james , United States
Mercure Pattaya Ocean Resort
8 Very good
Based on 1613 reviews

Well, as Mercure is french, I assume that the french management teach the Thai staff in french manners.

The staff, but not the bell boys, is very unfriendly and slow. During check-in procedures I was asked for a 2000 Baht "deposit" for the key-cards. What? How can I use a room without a key? Buggers. I would understand a deposit for a mini bar. A little fridge was on the room but totally empty. So, you have to give them a deposit for a room you already paid for. Service at the pool side on the first floor is more than slow. There are (electric-) bells installed between the sun beds. But no matter how often you ring the bell, you won't see any service staff. The hotel has seen better days. Black stains in the bathroom in the shower and around the sink everywhere. The pillows, however, were very comfortable. Nice pool facilities - especially if you have children, I don't. Sadly, the french trained staff does not make you feel home. And a place where I'm not feeling home has NO value for money.

Show more
Walter , Germany
Amari Ocean Hotel Pattaya
8.2 Excellent
Based on 3374 reviews

Amari Tower is ideally suited, situated on beach road sadly the beach is shabby and the sea contaminated.

Up side is the hotel as great family pools, plenty of sun beds, and the pool guys to get drinks/snacks if required. Everything was pretty much as we expected as we had done some research on the resort and the general area beforehand.

The standout feature is the resort's beautiful garden and general surrounds which are very well sculpted and maintained. The semi-private beach is reasonably clean and secluded, and thankfully free of the army of hawkers and umbrellas of other beaches. The sea isn't exactly crystal clear but it's better than many other more popular beaches in the region. The pool area is right next to the beach and is quite spectacular, but there weren't enough deckchairs for everyone so we mostly lay on the grass next to the beach. There is a themed water park nearby if the kids get bored. Our room was good, although we learned later that we had been upgraded. They pushed the twin beds together for us, making more than enough room for our young daughter to share. The breakfast was good, but quite expensive if you paid separately (we paid around $25 per breakfast upfront at check-in for our daughter, which wasn't refundable if she chose not to use it). We mostly ate elsewhere during our stay but other guests said the restaurant was good for lunch and dinner, but pricey. Be warned that the resort is in a quiet area and far from the main tourist town of Pattaya, which is either a good or bad thing depending on your perspective (a good thing for us!). It's also several hundred metres from the main road so taxis aren't the most convenient option for getting out and about. We had our own car so I can't comment on the hotel's own options for day-trips and tours. All-in-all this resort is best for those who want to chill out and do nothing in a secluded beachfront venue for a few days.

Martin , Germany
Rabbit Resort
8.8 Excellent
Based on 816 reviews

I'm going to start this review by saying that I don't like Pattaya - not one little bit! It's a horrid place, filled with all the kinds of seedy activities and even seedier people that have given Thailand a bad name over the years.

It's really not a nice place. That said, however, I will definitely go back to Pattaya now (or Jomtien, anyway), just so that I can stay at the Rabbit Resort again. It is without a doubt one of the most lovely little hidden gems of a hotel that I have ever come across. Jomtien is NOT Pattaya (thankfully)...it has a lovely stretch of beach that one can stroll along, and the Rabbit Resort is on that route. Easy to find (featured on most sat navs), with plentiful parking, it's ideally situated for a 'get-away-from-it-all' break...the hotel has its own section of umbrellas on the beach (free to guests), and the restaurant looks onto the sea... I only stayed one night, but I definitely wished that I could have extended my trip. The room was beautiful...big, bright and airy with quality furniture and a real Thai feel...the staff just could not have been more attentive or professional (without being too over the top), and both owners took time out from their busy schedules to ask us on numerous occasions if everything was ok... Breakfast was excellent (complete with the PERFECT omelette), and lunch was really tasty (and very reasonably priced). The Rabbit Resort routinely gets excellent reviews (and I must admit that there's more than a little part of me would like to keep this particular gem well-hidden and just for my own use), but I've never stayed in a hotel that deserved outstanding comments as much as this one does. Truly top notch...can't wait to go back again (longer this time, I hope!)...well done Mr and Mrs Rabbit - a big thank you to you and your awesome staff for making me want to visit you again...

I was a little skeptical about staying at a lower end accommodation but the pictures looked good the reviews were very positive.

Nemo's lived up to and exceeded every expectation I had. This place is immaculately clean. The location is fantastic. Outside of your front door is nearly every kind of restaurant you could ever want within just a few minutes. LK Metro is around the corner and you can be there in seconds. I never smoke in my room so when I would have the urge I would simply stop by "next door" at one of the LK Metro go-go's and have a cocktail and a quick puff. Family Mart and 7/11 are seconds away. Nemo's is guest friendly. It's quiet at night especially after LK shuts down around 2am. The fact there is an on-site massage shop was sooo convenient. Each morning I would wake up, shower, and on my way to breakfast or on my way back from breakfast stop and have a foot massage or full body (professional, not a naughty boy) massage. Soi Honey is one block over for that, the baht bus is minutes to Soi 6 or Walking Street. There's a dozen smaller beer bars within a couple minutes walk. Central Festival-7 minute walk. For cleanliness, quality of staff, the on-site massage shop (discounts for guests), newly remodeled rooms (accurate pictures), value, a good assortment of satellite TV channels (some in HD) you just can't beat this place. I would highly recommend to a friend. I will be back. One tip, I opted for the cheapest room which is on the fourth floor (if I remember correctly). If you have an aversion to steps for just a few more bucks/quid you can get an "upgraded room" on a lower floor (assuming availability). Tip-the Robin's Nest restaurant right next door has good food, good value, and a nice breakfast. Tip-take the baht bus on Soi Bukhao (sp?) to get to WS, don't walk all the way to Beach Road. If you're a rude loud jackle stay elsewhere. The hotel is accessed via the massage shop lobby and respect of other patrons is deserved.

The hotel is more than 1.5 kms walk from the Walking street, so try not to walk to WS, a mistake I did the first evening and ended up all sweaty and tired.

The best thing about this guest house is that it has a bar on level 1 which becomes a go-go bar in the evening. So basically you have in-house entertainment and its worth spending a few beers on. Flipside is its a bit noisy and the only entrance to the guest room is through that bar, which closes at 3 am. The staff were fantastic and friendly and always willing to help you. Rooms on the 3rd floor were not so noisy but since there is no lift, walking up and down can be a hassle, especially when you are coming back as a drunk. Internet speed was ok later but had some connectivity issues on day 1. No breakfast was a bummer but they don't have a restaurant or kitchen. The bed was very nice, even though the room was somewhat small and there was almost zero furniture. You have nothing to keep your luggage on. But even if small (double bed) the bed was amazingly comfortable. So I slept well every night. I can come back again to this guest house.

I originally booked for a few nights since it was an inexpensive guest house, figuring that was the best option to deal with jet lag.

I wound up staying four more night before moving to a bigger hotel that I had already pre-booked. After that, I came back here to the Siam Guest House. The room (25) is simple enough with a desk and frig and old wardrobe (only three hangers, though). TV reception isn't very good, but I didn't come to watch TV. The wireless is free and spotty at times, but good enough; and I've been using it a lot. Bathroom has a hand-held shower, but the space is pretty big, bigger than other local guest houses that I've checked out. And for $20US a day, it can't be beat. Just a few steps to all the baht bus taxis and restaurants and bars, and yet I can't hear any of them, and my room is right over the entrance. In short, this is an excellent place to start a Pattaya holiday, particularly for a solo traveler. Guests are permitted with no problem what so ever.

Westerly Hill Guest House
7.3 Very good
Based on 132 reviews

Stayed here 2 nights early August to check out Pattaya and in transit from BKK to Koh Chang. The location of this guesthouse is perfect being minutes walk from the beach, a multitude of dining options, bars, massage and of course Walking Street.

It is however suprisingly quiet despite being in the centre of all this action. It probably helped that my room (405) was up high and also at the back of tne building (not fronting soi 13/1 itself). The owner / manager explained to me at check in that there were actually 2 buildings, one with stairs (the one I stayed in) and one with an elevator so if you have any mobility issues you may wish to ask for the latter. Being a guesthouse rather than a hotel, there are no in house dining options (although there are so many options within minutes this is not an issue) and also not 24 hour check in/out so specify if you require early/late option and I am sure they will accommodate. Entry to the building was via electronic tag and room had safe so security not a problem. Room itself was clean and comfortable, air con was quiet and reliable as was water pressure and temperature. Bed was firm as is the Thai way but not a problem for me. Overall, an undre rated little gem in the centre of Pattaya and I would recommend and stay again.

Miracle House
8.2 Excellent
Based on 91 reviews

This is a small family-run guesthouse with friendly staff, and a pukka massage business downstairs. It is in a new building in a fairly quiet soi off Soi Lengkee.

Pluses: All furniture and fittings are nearly new; good TV with fair range of channels; fridge, excellent fast wireless internet; good value traditional Thai massage downstairs (200 baht); run by nice family with friendly staff; no food but close to affordable local restaurants and bars; good kingsize bed; in-room safe; good security with electronic lock on access door. Limitations: room is rather small; although good the bathroom has a Thai-style shower so that floor gets wet; staircase is rather narrow; no BPL football on the TV (no CTH only GMM). Overall this guesthouse provides excellent value, and room is big enough for a single traveller. The staff are very friendly and the girls know how to give a genuine Thai traditional massage (not like the naughty massage parlours around the corner). The hotel is in a generally quiet Soi, but there is some noise from the adjacent Vogue hotel car park from about 7.00 am. There are many bars and eating places in the local area.

My initial plan was to stay in Jomtien for only one night and two days which is more than enough having lived near Jomtien before and now living in Bangkok.

I did a quick search on agoda for accommodation. Usually I am not fussed about the rooms as long as the room and bathroom is clean cause after all I only need the room for few hours of sleep and then I'm out the whole day sightseeing or by the beach BUT staying at Sunshine Guest House was a whole different experience. I arrived a bit earlier than checking in time and was greeted by the wife of the owner. She had a lovely big smile and gave me a warm welcome. Checking in took no more than 2 mins and I was shown my room, how to use the safe etc. The room was immaculate; very spacious, clean with towels, toilet roll and soap. The bedding were fresh and clean and the bed was huge, extremely comfortable!!! It is very rare that I switch on the television whilst on vacation but I thought I'll check to see if they have BBC World News to see what is happening around the world. I put the tele on to find that it had 100 channels. The reception was excellent!!! I went through all the channels to discover one of my favourite that I have missed from back home-Zee TV!! I was ecstatic to discover this channel and watched a fair bit of tele at night! I really felt like I was back I n my family home.

Kamrul , United Kingdom
The Links Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 56 reviews

I actually loved my stay here at The Links. Very easy to find, close to arms and 24/7 convenience stores, bar scene also if thats your thing.

You can get airport bus, about 130 baht from 2nd level of airport, they run on hour every hour until about 8 or 9pm. About 1 hr 40 min journey in air con comfort - I always get off at Jomtien which is last stop and then get a baht bus back into Pattaya and it is easier to do this than get off earlier in Pattaya and get cab or bike taxi - just 10 min on baht bus and get off junction of South Rd and walk up to the soi as per address on left - probably a 10 min walk. The Links is a guest house hotel and to be honest I never saw the owners as they obviously out golfing all day - very friendly staff and attentive and helpful. Room nice and large, older furniture but very clean and sheets and duvet cover pillows changed every 3 days ( I was there one week). Room was clean with dvd player, sat channels, flat screen modern tv etc. There was a safe for security. I tried the food there and it was so good i eat breakfast there each day and several dinner meals. Excellent cooking for Western and Thai food alike, cook is well trained she says by western owner. There is an outdoor bar set up in street opposite so some noise , advise taking some ear plugs just in case, this is a friendly safe area in this street and of course you can walk here to the infamous Walking Street (google this) and beach walks and restaurants. In fact you can walk to most things from here. I have been to many guest houses, budget type hotels but I would definitely stay here again and it is superb value for money combined with friendly welcoming staff, from the cleaner to the front staff. One tip is to get a screen grab freeze on your iphone of the exact location so you can refer as you walk the street to find the hotel. I do this tip for all my trips. Have fun! Enjoy!

I've stayed at the D hotels in Pattaya several times but this was my first booking at the low cost D Apartment (Bldg 1).

I was checked in by a very sweet young lady who spoke little English so I wasn't given much information about the hotel's facilities or policies. I had a few issues early as a result of that but nothing major. Think I had the last room available in maybe the least expensive residence in the area so, as you might imagine, my expectations weren't great. What I got was a building with no elevator, a bare-bones room that smelled initially like cigarettes, no shower separator and a bathroom window that was locked open which allowed in all the street noise of Soi Baukhao. To access the hotel pool (which is in the new wing) I had to turn in my key at reception as if I were leaving the hotel. To get to Bldg 1's stairway I was directed through a small lobby that appeared to substitute as housekeeping's main work area. If you haven't been there before be careful when making your way thru that lobby as there are two small step downs that could easily be missed. Speaking of being careful, there are also a couple of steps in the stairway that have extended widths which could cause a person to stumble when descending if close attention isn't paid (personal experience). With that said, my room was cleaned everyday, had a decent tv, a fairly large refrigerator and good wifi. So all in all, a pretty good deal.

Pakdee ,Thailand

I enjoyed Pattaya a lot and could/should have stayed another day or two really, instead of only staying for 2 days (after staying in Bangkok for 4).

What I did not care for is I booked a tour and a hotel transport back to BKK airport, both of which flaked! It really left a bad taste in my mouth. I prepaid for one, confirmed for both of them and they both tanked. Neither of which had the decency to call and tell me they were cancelling! That was the most appalling part. That was the one major difference between Pattaya and Bangkok that I did notice, the people I scheduled things with were very eager to make sure they made contact with you like their reservationists said they would (i.e., leave messages with your hotel, email, etc.), whereas in Pattaya, they did not seem to care about whether or not the customer's needs were being met. I was very disappointed. The city itself, however, was a lot of fun. I would go back even if I had those 2 sour apple experiences. I just will be sure never to use those 2 companies again.

More about Pattaya

Pattaya has been a favorite relaxation destination for tourists and locals for over 40 years. The city is centrally located close to the capital city, so it usually sees a large influx of partygoers during long weekends.

Although Pattaya is mostly associated with lazy days on the beach followed by nightclubs, the city has accommodations for a more diverse group of visitors. Hotels in Pattaya cater to everyone from retired westerners, business travelers, young honeymooners, and families. It's an unlikely mix, and only Pattaya could make it seem so effortless.

Families often head to the quieter Jomtien Beach, a crescent slice of sand brimming with water sports and beach facilities. It’s just far enough away from the central party scene, and the hotels in this area quiet down earlier in the evening. Many family-friendly activities are based in North Pattaya, featuring Buddhist temples, elephant and nature parks, and weekend markets.

The famous nightlife epicenter of Pattaya is Walking Street, a neon-heavy after-hours pedestrian strip that follows the waterfront.

While Pattaya is widely known as Thailand's party destination, it's becoming an increasingly diverse place to vacation, with the city emphasizing the other quiet beaches and golf courses as alternatives to the bright lights.

There’s much more to see and learn about Pattaya, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

The city is centrally located close to the capital city, so it usually sees a large influx of partygoers during long weekends. Although Pattaya is mostly associated with lazy days on the beach followed by nightclubs, the city has accommodations for a more diverse group of visitors. Hotels in Pattaya cater to everyone from retired westerners, business travelers, young honeymooners, and families. It's an unlikely mix, and only Pattaya could make it seem so effortless. Families often head to the quieter Jomtien Beach , a crescent slice of sand brimming with water sports and beach facilities. It’s just far enough away from the central party scene, and the hotels in this area quiet down earlier in the evening. Many family-friendly activities are based in North Pattaya, featuring Buddhist temples, elephant and nature parks, and weekend markets. The famous nightlife epicenter of Pattaya is Walking Street , a neon-heavy after-hours pedestrian strip that follows the waterfront. While Pattaya is widely known as Thailand's party destination, it's becoming an increasingly diverse place to vacation, with the city emphasizing the other quiet beaches and golf courses as alternatives to the bright lights. There’s much more to see and learn about Pattaya, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
